alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 10:13AM CST until January 29 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... White Oak Creek Near Talco affecting Titus, Morris and Franklin Counties. For the White Oak Creek...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Oak Creek near Talco. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding of creek bottoms. Ranchers that may have cattle and equipment in the creek bottoms should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CST Sunday the stage was 16.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM CST Sunday was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 12.3 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 06/12/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1015 AM CST.
